critique: This document is an executive order from 1942 authorizing the Secretary of the Navy to take possession of and operate a plant of the General Cable Company. Given that this was during World War II, the order is aimed at ensuring the production of war materials. The order itself doesn't directly address ideological tilts, immigration, or social inclusion. It does expand executive power to ensure war materials are produced. It also centralizes control at the federal level, and prioritizes national security. Finally, it involves government intervention in the economy.
